retrieved_documents.text: XXIX of 2020. (2) All trusts created under Trust Act, 1882 (Act No. II of 1882) or registered under the Registration Act, 1908 (Act No. XVI of 1908) or any other law, for the time being in force, shall be required to be registered in accordance with sub-section (1) within the period as Government may, by notification, specify. (3)Any trust, which fails to register as required under sub-sections (1) and (2) shall cease to function or operate in any manner whatsoever and shall be proceeded against by the Director in terms of section 97... In the said Act, after section 12, the following new section shall be 7. inserted: - Insertion of section 12- A in Sindh Act No. XXIX of 2020. 12-A.Registration of Specialized Trust. - (1)For the purpose of registration of specialized trust under this Act, the trustee shall provide to the Director a No Objection Certification (NOC) from the relevant regulator which shall contain the prescribed information. In the said Act, in section 14, for the word and figures within 14 days of receiving the request from the Director the words within such period and manner as may be prescribed shall be substituted. Amendment of section 14 of Sindh Act No. XXIX of 2020. In the said Act, after section 16, the following new section shall be 9. inserted:- Insertion of section 16- A in Sindh Act No. XXIX of 2020. 16-A. Renewal of Registration.-(1)The registration of trust shall be renewed annually by the trustee in the manner and on payment of such fees as may be prescribed except a Specialized Trust. (2) The trustee shall apply for renewal of registration within thirty days prior to expiry of registration of the trust. (3) In case of any amendment in a trust by the trustee, shall also be registered in accordance with this Act in the manner and on payment of such fees as may be prescribed... In the said Act, in section 97, after clause (c), the following new 10. clauses shall be added:- Amendment of section

PROVINCIAL ASSEMBLY OF SINDH NOTIFICATION KARACHI, THE 28TH APRIL, 2021 NO.PASLegis-B-092021-The Sindh Trusts (Amendment) Bill, 2021 having been passed by the Provincial Assembly of Sindh on 29th March, 2021 and assented to by the Governor of Sindh on 23rd April, 2021 is hereby published as an Act of the Legislature of Sindh. THE SINDH TRUSTS (AMENDMENT) ACT, 2021 SINDH ACT NO. VIII OF 2021 AN ACT to amend the Sindh Trusts Act, 2020. WHEREAS it is expedient to amend the Sindh Trusts Act, 2020, in the Preamble. manner hereinafter appearing; It is hereby enacted as follows:- Short title and commencement. Amendment of section 2 of Sindh Act No. XXIX of 2020. 1. (1) This Act may be called the Sindh Trusts (Amendment) Act, 2021. (2) It shall come into force at once. In the Sindh Trusts Act, 2020, hereinafter referred to as the said Act, 2. in Section 2,- (i) (ii) in clauses (b), for the words the natural the word any shall be substituted; in clause (c),for the words the natural the word any

In the said Act, after section 118, the following new section shall be 11. inserted, namely: - Insertion of section 118-A in Sindh Act No. XXIX of 2020. 118-A. Delegation of powers and functions.-Notwithstanding anything contained in this Act, Government may, by notification in the official gazette, delegate any power or function under this Act to a regulator with respect to Specialized Trust, to be exercised in such manner and the circumstances as may be specified in the notification... ________ BY ORDER OF THE SPEAKER PROVINCIAL ASSEMBLY OF SINDH G.M.UMAR FAROOQ SECRETARY PROVINCIAL ASSEMBLY OF SINDH

PROVINCIAL ASSEMBLY OF SINDH NOTIFICATION KARACHI, THE 05TH JULY, 2010 NO.PASLegis-B-182010- The Sindh Finance Bill, 2010 having been passed by the Provincial Assembly of Sindh on 26th June, 2010 and assented to by the Governor of Sindh on 02nd July, 2010 is hereby published as an Act of the Legislature of Sindh. THE SINDH FINANCE ACT, 2010 SINDH ACT NO: XIII OF 2010 AN ACT to rationalize certain duties and taxes and provide for levy of Capital Value Tax on immovable property, in the Province of Sindh and to amend relevant laws. WHEREAS it is expedient to rationalize certain duties and taxes and provide for levy of Capital Value Tax on immovable property, in the Province of Sindh and to amend relevant laws, in the manner hereinafter appearing; Preamble. It is hereby enacted as follows :- 1. (1) This Act may be called the Sindh Finance Act, 2010. (2) It shall come into force on and from 1st day of July, 2010. 2. In the Schedule to the Stamp Act, 1899, in its application to the Province

query: What are the consequences outlined in the Sindh Trusts (Amendment) Act, 2021 for a trust (including those created under the Trust Act, 1882) that fails to comply with the new registration requirements?
